description: Easy on the eyes and minimal. Exactly what I was looking for.

I've so many reasons to recommend this app.
* easy to use
* ui is simple
* low memory footprint
* I love it

With no way to recover short of uninstalling

No thanks

Minimalist GNOME text editor. There are some must have features missing like multi (line/column) edit and git repository awareness. Otherwise, a perfectly clean and smooth editor. Thare's an obvious name collision that may confuse users: "Text Editor" has been gedit's application title for ages, thus unless this is meant as a successor to replace gedit in long term, I believe a different title would be welcomed.
Kwrite > Text Editor

Only thing I miss is my Dracula color theme. 
Contrary to a previous viewer, you can indeed turn on line and column numbers. Top bar to the right.

Some of the most basic feature, one would expect from a text editor is missing like making text bold, underlining text, creating list, etc.
It more like 'just text' rather than 'text EDITOR'.

I found it exceedingly hard to find an app that:
- just opened and edited plaintext files without bloat
- had reasonable defaults already set so you didn't need to fiddle with it forever
- looked/behaved sleek and modern.

This editor simply does those things and should definitely be the default for most people
Clean just like gedit but no option to globully disable spellcheck.
Has just enough features to be functional, but simple enough to be elegant
launches quicker than vscode, and useful for smaller edits.

If this editor had the ability to show line and column numbers, like gedit's status line, it would a full 5-star replacement. Unfortunately it's impossible to turn those on, the setting doesn't exist for this little editor, so can't use it. A shame, because I love the appearance, and how lightweight it feels otherwise.
summary: Really nice looking, missing one big feature

description: Epic! Way better than gedit becuase it supports dark mode
This is something that i was looking for, very simple and lightweight, better than gedit and kwrite . Great user interface and smooth
Very simple and practical text editor
Nice user interface and simple to use. Goodbye gedit
It looks great and work great so far. I really really like it. I just wish the text would be a lighter color.

This thing keeps opening up my previous documents, even drafts. I don't want this, I just need it to open a new document a save when I tell it to.

The current version is v41.1 as of writing this and I am using Fedora 35. I really hope this gets fixed because this looks very nice and has tons of features I'd make use of. I'll gladly change my rating to 5/5 if this gets fixed.
with c files the indentation setting does nothing. also changing dark/light from menu doesn't change it in preferences
summary: DONT CHECK SPELLING AND DONT INDENT MY C CODE WITH 2 SPACES

description: The only problem is the lack of features, but on the other hand the whole idea behind GNOME is minimalism and user friendliness. It's probably for the better that this app doesn't have coding features, as it is not a coding editor. Very polished and aesthetic.

When I see syntax highlighting I want it to be clear and colorful. The way this thing highlights html with grey, dark blue, and orange is not clear. And there's no way to change the highlighting without changing the entire theme.
summary: Default syntax highlighting and themes is...not so good

description: Best simple text editor.

I have always used CLI text editors. Ever since I installed Fedora 36 Beta and tried out this text editor, I was amazed. I now use this application more often compared to CLI alternatives like Neovim or GNU Nano.
gedit plugin its will be perfect on this
Everything works, clean and simple
please add status bar like the gedit. good overall
It's a text editor, lets yah open your text documents and edit them and it does it pretty well.

in fedora 36 with (under X) i get some weird bugs where i cannot move the window sometimes and it gets like 10px dark borders. then when I switch to another keyboard - text editor doesnt pick it up and i cannot type in another language - its still defaults to english.
summary: for me - it had bugs in fedora 36

description: love the ui design, but i need the extension like gedit
Does everything a text editor needs to do and more with a clean simple interface.
It's a good editor for my admittedly light needs but it could do with an unsaved changes indicator so I now to save and don't lose work in the event of any catastrophic failure or power loss.
It's kinda slow and I couldn't put in the effort of searching for line number settings so it didnt feel intuitive. Uninstalled for gedit.
summary: A pretty neat pretty text editor..

description: no recomendado se cierra solo
Meilleur en gtk4
Отличный текстовый редактор
